intro: Ipomoea pogonocalyx, commonly known as the velvetleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant is a member of the Convolvulaceae family and is known for its rapid growth and climbing habit. Its seeds are enclosed in a fleshy, red or orange capsule that splits open when mature. Ipomoea pogonocalyx is often found in disturbed soils and can become invasive in certain environments.
